intro: Alaticaulia trochilus, commonly known as the golden crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of narrow, silver-green leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its showy yellow flowers are arranged in a dense, cylindrical cluster at the top of the stem. Alaticaulia trochilus is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid conditions.
